column4: hi trying to compile an app and am getting: configure: error: no acceptable C compiler found in $PATH  but I have gcc installed, and g++ (according to synaptic)
can you run gcc?
just "gcc" or "sudo gcc" returns command not found
http://www.arslinux.com/~jorge/sources.list he has a java repository.
is that for amd64 as well?
probably not
what about the realplayer 10 installer?
you don't need an RPM.
oh I didnt see the bin
run it as root, and install to /opt/RealPlayer
berfore I reboot, trying to install my realplayer10.bin, I just do a ./realplayer10.bin right?
chmod 755 realplayer10.bin
install it in /opt/ ?
that's a safe place to put it.
so just /opt/realplayer ok?
no.
The installer will ask you to put links to /usr/local/bin/ answer yes, and then give it the directory of your mozilla installation. and you are done.
its asking: Enter the complete path to the directory where you want
/opt/RealPlayer/
damn get this error when running realplay: /opt/RealPlayer/realplay.bin: error while loading shared libraries: libgdk-x11-2.0.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
umm in synaptic I only list libgdk-imlib-ruby1.6 , libgdk-pixbuf-dev , and other libgdk-pixbuf- stuff
try the imlib..
